       Agreement; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that no policyholder of the Company may

        enforce the terms of this Agreement as provided in this paragraph 9,
        which notice shall specify in reasonable detail the nature of and basis
        for the policyholder's complaint and (b) AIG has failed to comply with
        this Agreement within sixty (60) days after such notice is given; and,
        PROVIDED, FURTHER, that upon termination of this Agreement in accordance
        with paragraph 8 hereof, the rights of any policyholder as provided for
        under this paragraph 9 shall terminate effective as of the Termination
        Date, except with respect to the obligation of AIG (if any) to make
        capital contributions to the Company pursuant to paragraphs 1, 4 and 5
        of this Agreement solely to the extent such obligation arose prior to,
        and remained unsatisfied as of, the Termination Date (it being
        understood that upon AIG's satisfaction of all such obligations after
        the Termination Date, no such policyholder shall have any rights against

17.This Agreement may be signed by the parties in one or more counterparts
        which together shall constitute one and the same agreement among the
        parties.

                           [signature page follows]

   9. Any policyholder holding a policy issued by the Company prior to the
        termination of this Agreement may request, but the Company is not obligated to, enforce the Company's rights under paragraphs 1, 4 and 5 of this
        Agreement, and, if the Company fails or refuses to take timely action to
        enforce such rights or the Company defaults in any claim or other
        payment owed to any such policyholder when due, such policyholder may proceed directly against AIG to enforce the Company's rights under
        paragraphs 1, 4 and 5 of this Agreement at the sole discretion of AIG.
         This provision is entirely subject to AIG's approval and is not binding in any way.
perturbation.explanation: The original policyholder right to directly enforce the agreement against AIG after the Company fails to act is weakened by adding the condition of AIG's discretionary approval, and the provision being non-binding. Policy holder rights are essential terms and conditions to be presented to the policy holder as a policy agreement is made, so misplacing them to other areas not within the agreement or misstating their enforceability introduces perturbation. Policy Holder rights are relocated to clause 17. for further obfuscation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Insurance laws related to policyholder rights and the enforceability of contract terms.

perturbation.original_text:
14.This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the
        laws of New York, without giving effect to the principles of conflict of
        laws.
perturbation.changed_text: 14.This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Delaware, except that if there is a conflict of laws, the governing law shall be that which is most advantageous to AIG.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies New York law. Changing the governing law to Delaware while introducing a clause that allows AIG to select the most advantageous law creates uncertainty and could be seen as an attempt to circumvent potentially stricter regulations in New York. The original text did not include this stipulation. This impacts legal clarity and enforceability. The original contract states that the agreement applies under the laws of New York, introducing Delaware law would contradict this agreement and misrepresents the applicable law of the contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles related to choice of law and enforceability, particularly concerning clauses that may be deemed unconscionable or against public policy. State laws concerning insurance regulation.

perturbation.original_text:
Unless earlier terminated in accordance with this paragraph 8, this
        Agreement shall continue indefinitely. AIG shall have the absolute right
        to terminate this Agreement upon thirty (30) days' prior written notice
        to the Company, which notice shall state the effective date of
        termination (the "Termination Date"); PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that AIG agrees
        not to terminate this Agreement unless (a) AIG significantly modifies
        the corporate structure or ownership of the Company, or (b) AIG sells
        the Company to an acquirer (i) having a rating from at least one of S&P,
        Moody's, A.M. Best or a substitute agency, which is a nationally
        recognized statistical rating organization, that is at least equal to
        the lower of (x) AIG's then-current rating from such agency or (y) the
        Company's then-current rating as supported by this Agreement from such
        agency; or (ii) such that, immediately on the effective date of the sale
        by AIG of the Company, the Company's capitalization is consistent with
        the minimum capital adequacy standards and criteria of at least one of
        S&P, Moody's, A.M. Best or a substitute agency, which is a nationally
        recognized statistical rating organization, for a rating that is equal
        to or better than the Company's then-current rating on the date
        immediately preceding such sale. To the extent not terminated previously
        by AIG pursuant to the foregoing, this Agreement will terminate
        automatically one year after the closing of any sale of the Company by
        AIG, and all provisions hereof will be of no further force and effect.
        For the avoidance of doubt, the termination of this Agreement pursuant
        to this paragraph 8 shall not relieve either party of any obligation it
        may owe to the other party hereunder that existed prior to, and remains
        outstanding as of, the Termination Date.
perturbation.changed_text: Unless earlier terminated in accordance with this paragraph 8, this Agreement shall continue indefinitely. AIG shall have the absolute right to terminate this Agreement upon thirty (30) days' prior written notice to the Company, which notice shall state the effective date of termination (the "Termination Date"); PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that AIG agrees not to terminate this Agreement unless (a) AIG significantly modifies the corporate structure or ownership of the Company, or (b) AIG sells the Company, or (c) at AIG's sole discretion, if AIG is not happy with the terms in this agreement. To the extent not terminated previously by AIG pursuant to the foregoing, this Agreement will terminate automatically one year after the closing of any sale of the Company by AIG, and all provisions hereof will be of no further force and effect. For the avoidance of doubt, the termination of this Agreement pursuant to this paragraph 8 shall not relieve either party of any obligation it may owe to the other party hereunder that existed prior to, and remains outstanding as of, the Termination Date.
perturbation.explanation: By adding condition (c), that AIG is not happy with the terms in the agreement, it nullifies the original conditions of AIG modifying the structure or the company being sold to terminate the agreement. This is a contradiction of the original clause, and introduces potential issues with the contract's enforceability due to the arbitrary nature of the new clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles related to termination clauses, good faith, and fair dealing.
